translation.en: [Marcella] Thanks.
-[line continues ringing] -[Jason] Marcella, what do you want?
-Jason, you've got to help me. -I can't.
translation.ko: - 제이슨, 나 좀 도와줘 - 안 돼

translation.en: No, there has to be a reason. Just tell me why.
translation.ko: 이유가 있을 거 아니야 말해 줘

translation.en: Look... [sighs] I'll call you once I've had time to think about things.
translation.ko: 당신은 생각할 시간 필요하니까 나중에 전화할게

translation.en: Well, what am I supposed to think about?
You didn't say anything. And I don't know anything.
translation.ko: 아무 말도 안 해 줬잖아 아는 게 없다고

translation.en: I'll call you tomorrow, okay? This is not a good moment.
What am I supposed to tell the kids?
I don't know.
Look, I really can't talk right now. I'm in a meeting.
translation.ko: 지금은 통화 못 해 회의 중이야

translation.en: You went back to work?
Yeah. You went back to work tonight?
Yes, I went back to work.
Er, wait! Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait.
DTG Construction SE1, please.
Evening.
[woman] Hi, love.
Hiya, Dash.
Said!
[Sylvie] Busy morning? [Jason] I had to take the car to the garage.
-I thought it was brand new. -It is.
This was more the... human factor. [Phil] Sylvie.
Eh, crumbs.
Phil!
[Phil chuckles] Nice to see you. [Sylvie] Glad you could make it.
[Jason] Phillip.
[Sylvie] So, how's the family? Fine, fine. Time moves on.
translation.ko: - 가족들은 어때요? - 잘 있죠, 세월 빨라요

translation.en: -Sarah turned 16 last week. -Really?
Well, say hello and congratulations from me.
It's not bad, eh? [Phil] Indeed.
I hear you've started doing concrete jobs for Brenthams...
20% cheaper than you're doing them for me.
They're a new relationship.
It's a way of getting a foothold in new markets.
Well, have you got tired of your old relationships?
Of course not.
Jason?
With this new information, I took the liberty of rewriting our contracts.
translation.ko: 그 정보를 바탕으로 우리 계약서를 수정했어요

translation.en: [chuckles] You can't do that, Sylvie.
I represent more than half your turnover.
-[chuckles] Sylvie-- -It's a long way down, Phil.
Metaphorically speaking. That wasn't meant as a threat.
You'll drop by a third, but you won't fall all the way.
-[car door closing] -[Emma] Hi, it's Emma. Please leave a message, and I'll get back to you. Thanks, bye!
Ems, it's Mum. It's nothing in particular.
-I just wanted to, erm... -[knocking on door]
Well, I hope everything's fine, and, er, we'll catch up soon, okay?
Big hug. I love you.
[mispronouncing] Marcella Backland?
translation.ko: - 마르셀라 백랜드 맞습니까? - 마르첼라예요, 저 맞아요

translation.en: -It's "Marchella," but yeah. -DI Rav Sangha.
translation.ko: - 마르셀라 백랜드 맞습니까? - 마르첼라예요, 저 맞아요 라브 생거 경위입니다 로라 포터 경감님과 일하죠

translation.en: I work with DCI Laura Porter.
translation.ko: 라브 생거 경위입니다 로라 포터 경감님과 일하죠

translation.en: -Right. -It's about the Grove Park murders.
Come in.
[Rav] You might not remember. It was a long time ago.
2005. Two women, one man. Killed in their homes.
translation.ko: 2005년, 여성 둘과 남성 하나가 자택에서 살해됐죠

translation.en: Plastic bags over their heads.
Tied around their throats with insulating tape.
Hands and feet tied with cable ties.
Trophies taken from the scenes.
[Rav] I'm impressed. [Marcella] Well, don't be.
We never got him. Yeah. Well, it looks like he's back.
translation.ko: - 범인을 못 잡았거든요 - 그가 돌아온 모양이에요

translation.en: We found our second victim last night.
-An 11-year gap? -It looks like it.
So the woman we found last night, Carol Fincher,
she lost her job at Bonn Electronics six months ago.
Now, Laura seems to think she remembers interviewing someone called Bonn
translation.ko: 로라가 저번 수사 때 본이란 남자를 심문했다는데

translation.en: from the previous investigation, but we cannot find the transcript.
translation.ko: 로라가 저번 수사 때 본이란 남자를 심문했다는데 기록을 못 찾겠어요

translation.en: Mmm, the second victim was dating a Clive Bonn. Er...
Yeah, but a few weeks before she was murdered, we interviewed him,
translation.ko: 네, 살해되기 몇 주 전부터요 심문했는데 그는 알리바이가 있었죠

translation.en: but he had an alibi.
-Clive Bonn. -Yeah, lives in Harrow...
or did at the time.
Can I take a look?
That's Liz Harper. Husband came home and found her two weeks ago.
translation.ko: 리즈 하퍼예요, 남편이 2주 전에 돌아와서 발견했죠

translation.en: Hmm. And?
Carol Fincher. Divorced, no children, lived alone.
translation.ko: 캐럴 핀처요, 이혼했고 자녀는 없으며 혼자 살았죠

translation.en: Found her last night, but as you can see, killed before Harper.
Hmm. Peter Cullen. Have you talked to him? -He was our prime suspect. -Mmm-hmm.
translation.ko: 피터 컬렌은 만나 봤어요? 유력한 용의자였죠

translation.en: It's not him. He's behind bars.
-For what? -Manslaughter.
Killed his wife eight years ago.
-So he has killed? -Yes, but not these two.
Yeah, can I, er, keep these? No. Why?
Mmm, just to look over with a fresh pair of eyes.
But you're not on the force, are you? So... you can't.
translation.ko: 하지만 경찰은 아니니까 그건 안 돼요

translation.en: Do you want to call Laura and ask?
DCI Laura Porter. Erm, hey, it's... it's Marcella Backland.
Hi, Marcella. My God, it's been ages. How are you?
So one of your detectives visited me today.
translation.ko: 당신 밑에 있는 형사가 오늘 찾아왔어요

translation.en: Yes, Rav. Did you find something in the reports?
translation.ko: 라브가 갔지 사건 보고서에서 뭐 찾았어?

translation.en: I want to come back to work.
[Rav] This is DS Marcella Backland.
She's been on a career break for several years,
translation.ko: 몇 년 동안 서를 떠나 가정에 충실했는데

translation.en: raising a family, but she's back now,
translation.ko: 몇 년 동안 서를 떠나 가정에 충실했는데 이번에 복귀했고 우리랑 일하게 될 겁니다

translation.en: and she's gonna be working with us.
translation.ko: 이번에 복귀했고 우리랑 일하게 될 겁니다

translation.en: Now, Marcella worked on the Grove Park case back in 2005,
so we're pleased she's joining our team.
Right. Forensics have finished at Carol Fincher's place.
translation.ko: 과학 수사팀이 캐럴 핀처 집을 수색해

translation.en: Same kind of plastic bag and tape.
[Marcella] Sorry, the same as in 2005, or on the other new victim?
Both. No signs of forced entry. It all points to the same offender.
translation.ko: 둘 다랑요, 강제 침입 흔적도 없고 동일범으로 보여요

translation.en: Did you get a hold of Clive Bonn?
Yeah, and he claims to have never met, or even heard of Carol Fincher or Liz Harper.
translation.ko: 캐럴 핀처나 리즈 하퍼를 만난 적도 없고 전혀 모른대요

translation.en: And what about the other suspects from the 2005 investigation?
Well, we've got hold of pretty much all of them.
They're being questioned and written off. Alex.
Right. On all the pictures we've got of Carol Fincher,
she's wearing this Thomas Sabo bracelet with six charms on it.
translation.ko: '토마스 사보' 팔찌를 차고 있죠 장식 여섯 개짜리인데 없어졌어요

translation.en: It's missing.
Carol's telephone and computer records.
She was registered with a dating site, Meet. That's M-E-E-T, not M-E-A-T.
Anyway, erm, we're trying to work out whether she's had any contact with people on that site.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 거기 회원이랑 만났는지 조사 중이에요

translation.en: Right, and was Liz Harper registered with them as well?
We're working on it. But the... [sighs]
the four last unanswered calls to Carol's phone
translation.ko: 캐럴 휴대전화의 부재중 전화 네 통은

translation.en: were from a former colleague, Joanna Dogan.
translation.ko: 전 동료인 조애나 더간이 건 거예요

translation.en: Right. Alex, Marcella, go and find her.
See if she knows anything about who Carol might have met.
You want me to go? Is that a problem?
-No, it's just-- -You weren't expecting to work today?
translation.ko: - 그게 아니라... - 오늘은 놀 줄 알았어?

translation.en: -Of course I was-- -Well, then.
[Joanna] I feel so guilty. I should have gone over. [Marcella] Why didn't you?
translation.ko: - 가 봤어야 하는데 걸리네요 - 왜 안 갔죠?

translation.en: There were times where she wanted to be left alone.
translation.ko: 캐럴은 혼자 있고 싶어 할 때가 있어요

translation.en: [Alex] You rang her... quite a bit.
You didn't think it was strange when she didn't call you back?
[Joanna] To be honest, I was a tiny bit relieved.
She couldn't stop going on about her husband leaving her.
Well, maybe it was the worst thing that ever happened to her.
Right. It's just, there is a limit to what you can bear to hear over and over.
translation.ko: 똑같은 말을 계속 듣는 건 한계가 있잖아요

translation.en: Were you aware that she was a recovering alcoholic?
[Joanna] Yes.
And it didn't occur to you that...
translation.ko: 다시 술을 마셔서 연락 못 할 수도 있다는

translation.en: maybe she'd started drinking again and that's why she didn't call you back?
translation.ko: 다시 술을 마셔서 연락 못 할 수도 있다는 생각은 안 했어요?

translation.en: I said I felt guilty, didn't I?
Do you, erm... do you mind if I... if I take this?
Erm, no.
[Marcella] Thank you.
Did, erm... did Carol ever mention a Peter Cullen?
translation.ko: 캐럴이 피터 컬렌 얘기 안 했어요?

translation.en: No. You've never seen this man?
Erm... no.
-Sure? -Yeah.
Thanks.
Marcella... why are you asking questions about Peter Cullen?
translation.ko: 마르첼라, 피터 컬렌에 대해 왜 물어봤지?

translation.en: Well, he's not locked up, is he? He's in an open prison,
translation.ko: 그는 갇히지 않았잖아요 개방 교도소에 있어서 일주일에 사흘 빵집에서 일하죠

translation.en: doing a work scheme three days a week in a bakery.
translation.ko: 개방 교도소에 있어서 일주일에 사흘 빵집에서 일하죠

translation.en: You said he was behind bars, so he couldn't have done it.
translation.ko: 경위님은 그가 갇혀서 범인이 아니라고 했지만요

translation.en: Prison officers drive him to the bakery and back.
And then his supervisor's responsible for him during the day.
2005, his car was spotted one block away from the first murder.
translation.ko: 2005년 첫 살인 사건 현장 근처에서 그의 차가 발견됐어요

translation.en: Many cars were, and he had a very good explanation for being there.
He had exactly the same insulating tape in his car.
translation.ko: - 차에 같은 테이프도 있었죠 - 흔한 상표니까

translation.en: Well, it's a common brand, and he was an electrician.
translation.ko: - 차에 같은 테이프도 있었죠 - 흔한 상표니까 - 알리바이도 없었고요 - 다 정황 증거잖아

translation.en: -And he didn't have any alibis. -It's all circumstantial.
And we've looked into it, we've ruled him out,
and just so you know, we don't fly solo on this team.
translation.ko: 우리 팀에서는 단독 행동 용납 안 해

translation.en: Clive Bonn.
You said he didn't know Carol Fincher, right?
[Rav] Yeah, why?
Alex, get Laura on the phone.
[Marcella] Okay, Mr Bonn, you said...
that you'd never met Carol Fincher.
The woman on the right is Carol Fincher and the man in the middle is you.
Apparently, I was wrong.
[Alex] When and where was that photo taken? Why don't you ask the photographer about that?
translation.ko: - 언제, 어디서 찍은 거죠? - 찍은 사람한테 물어봐요

translation.en: I'm asking you.
The company was having its 20th anniversary in July,
so I came back from Rome for that.
And met Carol Fincher?
translation.ko: - 그때 캐럴 핀처 만났어요? - 우연히 만나서

translation.en: If "met" means accidentally ending up on the same photo as her, then, yes.
translation.ko: - 그때 캐럴 핀처 만났어요? - 우연히 만나서 같이 사진까지 찍게 됐을 뿐이에요

translation.en: You fired her a month later. [Clive] We let 50 people go at that time.
translation.ko: - 한 달 후에 잘랐고요 - 그때 50명 해고했어요

translation.en: HR handled everything.
Liz Harper. You said you never met her, either.
-[Clive] You got a photo of us, too? -Is there one?
translation.ko: 그 여자랑 찍은 사진도 있어요? 찍긴 했나요?

translation.en: No.
So, er, are there any other women who I don't know
you want to talk to me about, or are we done?
translation.ko: 그 얘기 할 건가요? 아니면 끝났어요?

translation.en: No, we're done. Thank you.
[Rav] Clive Bonn, connected to one of the 2005 victims and to Carol Fincher.
translation.ko: 클라이브 본은 2005년의 피해자와 캐럴 핀처랑 연결됐어

translation.en: Now, if there's any connection to the other victims, I want us to find it now.
Mark, contact the police in Rome.
See if they've had any murders similar to ours between 2006 and now.
Er, Clive Bonn had an alibi in 2005.
Yeah, and he moved to Italy in 2006 and the murders stopped.
translation.ko: 클라이브 본이 2006년 이탈리아로 가며 살인이 멈췄어

translation.en: He returned to London three months ago and we got new bodies.
translation.ko: 석 달 전, 그가 돌아오자 다시 시작됐지

translation.en: Could be a coincidence. Could be, but it's enough of a reason for us to investigate.
But we don't care that the murders started again
translation.ko: 근데 피터 컬렌이 세상 밖으로 나오며

translation.en: when Peter Cullen got in touch with the outside world?
All right.
What did I say about Cullen?
translation.ko: - 컬렌은 뭐라고 했지? - 용의 선상에서 뺐다고요

translation.en: That you've ruled him out, and I think that's a mistake.
translation.ko: - 컬렌은 뭐라고 했지? - 용의 선상에서 뺐다고요 - 그건 실수 같아요 - 당신 생각은 관심 없어

translation.en: I don't care what you think.
translation.ko: - 그건 실수 같아요 - 당신 생각은 관심 없어

translation.en: He's in prison, being monitored around the clock.
[whispers] Forget about him.
Peter. Long time, no see.
What do you want? What do you think I want?
I don't know. A loaf, please.
Anything in particular? It doesn't matter, you choose.
Thanks.
Oh, they're beautiful.
[Henry] Hi, late, sorry.
[Stephen] No worries. Champagne?
translation.ko: - 늦어서 죄송해요 - 괜찮아 - 샴페인 줄까? - 안녕

translation.en: [Henry] Hi. [Grace] Hi.
[Henry] Oh, what's the occasion? It's our fourth anniversary.
Really? Well, congratulations.
We got the roses from Grace.
-Actually, they're from both of us. -[Sylvie] No, they're not.
No, they're not.
[inhales deeply] So, did you take a look at the Lambeth project?
Yes, and we're not going to change a thing.
Erm, what's with the Lambeth project?
[Henry] We're breaking our agreement with the chief planning officer.
translation.ko: 최고 기획 책임자랑 합의를 깨는 거예요

translation.en: How are we breaking our agreement?
Well, we got to buy the land based on the promise
of building a public green space on the roof.
It is going to be green, and it's going to be open to the public.
translation.ko: 녹지도 만들고 대중에게 공개도 할 거야

translation.en: If they pay.
And if they don't mind crowds, since over half the surface area
translation.ko: 돈 내고 복잡해도 괜찮다면요 절반 이상이 술집과 식당, 스파 부지잖아요

translation.en: is being given over to bars, restaurants and spas.
translation.ko: 절반 이상이 술집과 식당, 스파 부지잖아요

translation.en: -It's more profitable. -[Henry] Profitability is not the issue.
translation.ko: - 더 수익이 높잖아 - 수익성 문제가 아니죠

translation.en: We promised them a building that was environmentally responsible.
[Stephen] Okay, that's enough of the business talk. Let's celebrate, shall we?
translation.ko: 일 얘기는 그만하고 축하 파티나 하자

translation.en: Why do we even have a department for environmental issues if we're going to completely ignore them?
translation.ko: 무시할 거면 환경 담당 부서는 왜 둬요?

translation.en: Because you needed a job, and unlike my daughter,
translation.ko: 네가 일이 필요했잖아 내 딸과 달리 넌 할 줄 아는 일도 없고

translation.en: you can't actually do anything.
translation.ko: 내 딸과 달리 넌 할 줄 아는 일도 없고

translation.en: [clicks tongue] Stephen. Grace. Henry.
Henry, come on.
So you were home.
You still consider this your home?
Where are you living at the moment?
At Greg's. We'll have to see after that.
translation.ko: 그레그 집 그 후는 차차 생각해야지 그리고 차는...

translation.en: Hey, about the car...
translation.ko: 그 후는 차차 생각해야지 그리고 차는...

translation.en: What?
Forget it.
I probably deserved it.
We're gonna have to tell the kids.
I'll tell them when they come home from school at the weekend.
It'll turn into such a big thing if we both drive up there.
But it is a big thing!
No.
I'm grateful to you for everything.
But these last few years... I've felt alone.
Like, we've nothing in common... except the kids.
No, that is not a reason. That's something you work at.
I don't love you any more.
Jason?
Jason?
Jason, where are you?
[Jason] Why? What do you want?
It's just like I can't quite...
I can't remember you leaving.
Really? You more or less kicked me down the stairs.
Yeah, erm...
[stuttering] I don't know what happened, erm... [Jason] Well, I do.
[stammering] I'll ring you later, okay?
-Alcina. -I'm in the bathroom.
Listen, work have just called, so I'm heading out, okay?
[Alcina] All right, darling. See you later.
Maddy!
[Maddy] Hey. [Peter] Hi.
-These are for you. -Why am I getting flowers?
Oh. As a thank you...
for all your help.
I didn't realise this was going to be the last time.
Well, I've got everything I need, I think.
Unless... you've thought of something.
I can help you a lot more. A lot, lot more.
translation.ko: 난 훨씬 더 많은 도움을 줄 수 있어

translation.en: I'd really like to go on seeing you.
You're gonna think it's worth it. I promise.
Yeah. It'd be nice.
-Sorry, I'm late. -Not interested. We've got a third victim.
translation.ko: - 늦어서 죄송해요 - 세 번째 희생자 나왔어

translation.en: Benjamin Williams.
We checked Bonn. According to his wife, he was at home at the time of the murder.
translation.ko: 부인 말에 따르면 본은 사건 시간에 집에 있었대요

translation.en: There's a shop outside Williams' flat with CCTV. Go and get the footage.
translation.ko: 윌리엄스 집 근처의 가게에 CCTV 있으니까 확인해 봐

translation.en: Can't one of the DCs do that? Yeah, they could.
translation.ko: - 순경이 하면 안 돼요? - 해도 되지

translation.en: Mark, do me a favour. Will you do an identity check on...
translation.ko: 마크, 이 사람 신원 좀 확인해 줘

translation.en: this girl here?
-Her first name's Maddy. -[sighs] Who's the guy?
Peter Cullen.
Okay, send it to me, but... if Rav asks, I'm gonna tell.
translation.ko: 나한테 보내요 라브가 물어보면 거짓말은 못 해요

translation.en: I'm a terrible liar.
Good. I wish more men were.
In brief, profitability is up.
Thank you, Grace.
-Let's move on to the next issue. -Forgive me. Just one more thing.
translation.ko: 고마워, 그레이스 다음으로 넘어가지 죄송한데 하나만 덧붙일게요

translation.en: Our project in Lambeth.
This isn't on the agenda.
I have an item on the agenda, and I haven't finished yet.
[Grace] As you can see, my brother's report clearly raises issues.
So, Jason, couldn't the council sue us, given the current setup?
translation.ko: 제이슨 이 상태로는 우리가 고소당할 수 있죠?

translation.en: I don't have the entire agreement in my head.
Well, we promised them a park. Is that what we're supplying?
Well, that, like so much else, is... open to interpretation.
And if the council's interpretation is that we're not keeping our promises,
translation.ko: 의회에서 우리가 약속을 안 지킨다고 해석하면

translation.en: could that affect future construction work on publicly owned sites?
Well, obviously, it could, in theory.
Can they shut down Lambeth?
Oh, for God's sake, he's not a bloody fortune teller.
Jason?
Once again... in theory, yes.
They could.
Thank you. I'd like to call a vote on whether we should have
translation.ko: 오빠 부서의 램버스 프로젝트 재검토 여부를 두고

translation.en: my brother and his department take another look at the Lambeth project.
translation.ko: 오빠 부서의 램버스 프로젝트 재검토 여부를 두고 찬반 투표를 하고 싶어요

translation.en: Okay.
Hi, there. What can I do for ya?
[sarcastically] Okay, thanks. Bye.
-Karen? -[laughing] Yeah.
Good to meet you.
-You look fantastic. -Thanks.
You made me go against Sylvie.
I asked you to answer a question as head of legal affairs.
Everyone's angry with you.
-Not Henry. -Everyone who matters.
So why go against her?
Henry doesn't care or doesn't understand,
translation.ko: 헨리는 관심도 없고 이해도 못 해

translation.en: but you, you're too smart to put your neck on the line, Grace.
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 목숨 걸기엔 넌 똑똑하잖아

translation.en: Especially for him.
translation.ko: - 그것도 헨리 때문에? - 램버스가 피해 줄 거예요

translation.en: Lambeth might hurt us. I was doing my job.
translation.ko: - 그것도 헨리 때문에? - 램버스가 피해 줄 거예요 제 일을 한 건데 책임자로서 기뻐하셔야죠

translation.en: As chairman, you should be happy.
translation.ko: 제 일을 한 건데 책임자로서 기뻐하셔야죠

translation.en: [scoffs] I'm not the one you need to make happy in this family.
translation.ko: 이 집안에서 내 기분 맞출 필요는 없어

translation.en: And, believe me, it's definitely not your job to make your mother lose face.
translation.ko: 네 엄마 망신 주는 건 네 일도 아니고

translation.en: [Jason] Jason Backland, DTG Construction.
I can't take your call right now,
but if you leave a message, I'll get back to you as soon as I can.
translation.ko: 메시지 남겨 주시면 최대한 빨리 연락드리겠습니다

translation.en: [Henry] What the hell was that? [Grace] What was what?
Little sister fighting for me. You think she's gonna respect me more?
translation.ko: 여동생이 편들어 주면 새어머니가 날 존중할까?

translation.en: I was... just trying to help.
My stepmother already thinks that that I'm useless, so how was that helping?
translation.ko: 지금도 쓸모없는 놈 취급인데 그게 도움 되겠어?

translation.en: Help those who ask for help. Okay?
Okay.
Hey there, mate? Peter.
I'm in the room next door.
If you need help with anything, you can always ask--
Yeah, I'm not going to blow you... so you can fuck off.
translation.ko: - 도움이 필요하면... - 거시기는 안 빠니까 그냥 꺼져

translation.en: I'm not gay.
Great. You can still fuck off.
You all right?
[Mark] Marcella...
[stammers] That photo you gave me on your phone yesterday.
The girl with Peter Cullen.
I know which one, Mark. I only gave you one.
translation.ko: 나도 뭔지 알아 딱 한 장 줬잖아

translation.en: Yeah, well, that.
I've got an ID on her.
Maddy Stevenson.
You know, she was a much better detective than me when we were working together.
translation.ko: 같이 일하던 시절에 나보다 훨씬 유능했던 친구야

translation.en: Oh, yeah? Why is that?
Give her a long enough leash, you'll find out.
translation.ko: 알아서 하게 두고 보면 알게 될 거야

translation.en: How long, Laura?
As always, I trust your good judgement.
[shopkeeper sighs] 300 quid?
Two...
Three, all right? Thanks.
Thank you.
[man] Hey!
Hey, you. Hey, Samantha.
It's all right. I know who you are.
Well, if you can do it in front of a camera, couldn't you, like, do it live?
translation.ko: 카메라 앞에서 하는 것처럼 실제로 해 주면 안 돼요?

translation.en: I've got money. I'll pay you.
More, if you'll... do stuff. Please.
Show a bit of gratitude next time people are trying to be friendly to you.
translation.ko: 다음부터는 호의를 베푸는 사람들한테 고마운 줄 알아

translation.en: My name is Marcella Backland.
You know my husband.
